Thus, let me structure the code:

program codeforces_problem_400b
    implicit none
    integer :: n, m, i, returnDex
    integer, allocatable :: arr_length(:)
    character(len=:), allocatable :: arrs(:)

    ! Read n and m.
    read *, n, m

    ! Allocate the string array with length m each.
    allocate( character(len=m) :: arrs(n) )

    ! Read each string.
    do i =1, n
        read *, arrs(i)
        ! Perhaps check if the length matches m....
        ! Not needed; assume inputs are correct.
    end do

    ! Now, compute the differences and check conditions.
    allocate( arr_length(n) )
    returnDex =0
    do i =1, n
        character(len=m) :: current_str = arrs(i)
        integer :: posG, posS
        posG = index(current_str, 'G')
        posS = index(current_str, 'S')

        if (posG > posS) then
            returnDex = -1
        else
            ! valid, compute the difference
            arr_length(i) = posS - posG
        end if
    end do

    ! Now decide output.
    if ( returnDex == -1 ) then
        print *, -1
    else

        ! Count the number of unique elements in arr_length(1:n).
        ! Using the presence flag method, with m.

        ! Since some elements could have the same difference.

        integer :: max_diff
        logical, allocatable :: present(:)
        integer :: count =0, j

        max_diff = m-0  
        ! Wait the maximum possible difference is m-1?  Because if G is in position 1 and S in position m, difference is m-1.

        allocate( present(0:max_diff) )  ! indexes 0 to m-1, 0 is unused but safe.

        present = .false.

        do j =1, n
            current_d = arr_length(j)
            present(current_d) = .true.
        end do

        ! count the number of true in present(1:max_diff)
        count =0
        do j=1, max_diff
            if ( present(j) ) then
                count = count +1
            end if
        end do

        print *, count
        deallocate(present)
    end if

    deallocate( arr_length, arrs )

end program
